newsitem.title: DUBAI: Iran opens airport at Qeshm island.
newsitem.headline: Iran opens airport at Qeshm island.

text.p: Iran has opened an airport at Qeshm island, site to one of the country's three free trade zones, the official Iranian news agency IRNA said on Wednesday.
"The Qeshm international airport became officially operational here on Tuesday," IRNA said with President Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani inaugurating the airport.
It said the airport cost almost $15 million and has a 4.5 km (2.8- mile) runway.
Qeshm is one of three free trade zones Iran set up in 1989 to attract foreign investment. - Reuters Air Cargo Service Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+5017
